trans-unit.source: Provides a type-safe way to set the <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByParams*> property.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByParams%2A> property identifies which HTTP `Get` or `Post` parameters ASP.NET uses to uniquely identify a variation of the response when there are multiple cached responses for a resource.
This is useful when a response depends on a set of client inputs, such as headers or parameters.
The HttpCacheVaryByParams is not directly related to HTTP cache-control headers, but helps ensure that a client or proxy varies by the specified parameters.

For more information about `VaryByParams`, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125) site.
See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByParams"></xref> class.

Gets an array of values which specify the HTTP <xref uid="langword_csharp_GET" name="GET" href=""></xref> or <xref uid="langword_csharp_POST" name="POST" href=""></xref> parameters to be used for varying the cache.
An array of values which contain the HTTP <xref uid="langword_csharp_GET" name="GET" href=""></xref> or <xref uid="langword_csharp_POST" name="POST" href=""></xref> parameters for varying the cache.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether an HTTP response varies by <xref uid="langword_csharp_Get" name="Get" href=""></xref> or <xref uid="langword_csharp_Post" name="Post" href=""></xref> parameters.

Setting the IgnoreParams property to `true` is equivalent to setting the [@ OutputCache](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28a9e101-fb44-4198-9cb6-b8a52312fec2) directive `VaryByParams` attribute to "none" for the resource.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if HTTP request parameters are ignored; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cache varies according to the specified HTTP request parameter.

When used as an accessor (getter), the Item indexer returns `true` if a value for the specified parameter is found in the current parameters collection, or if the collection is set to vary by * (an asterisk), which indicates all parameters. When used as a mutator (setter), the Item indexer sets the value for the parameter in the parameters collection that corresponds to the specified header to `true`. The value * can be specified, which indicates all parameters.
The name of the custom parameter.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the cache should vary by the specified parameter value.

Sets an array of values which specify the HTTP <xref uid="langword_csharp_GET" name="GET" href=""></xref> or <xref uid="langword_csharp_POST" name="POST" href=""></xref> parameters to be used for varying the cache.
An array of values which contain the HTTP <xref uid="langword_csharp_GET" name="GET" href=""></xref> or <xref uid="langword_csharp_POST" name="POST" href=""></xref> parameters for varying the cache.
